comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Due to the lack of trams but evidence of tram infrastructure, I think this is about November / December1899. The George Street tramway had a soft opening with no ceremony on 8 December 1899 ( trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14260902 ). After that time there would have been trams everywhere; they ran every few minutes and helped rid the streets of horse-drawn buses, still evident in this picture. Several other Tyrrell Collection photos have turned up on Flickr showing George Street with tram lines, poles, and wires, but no trams. Were they taken as a record of pre-tramway traffic about December 1899? Also not evident here is the Sydney Harbour Trust building (opened 1903) about to be built behind the Anthony Hordern advertisement, in front of the Fire Station. www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/2715092837/. It would have taken at least a year to build. Neither is any demolition of slums in The Rocks apparent; surely a sign this is before 1900? Similar view about 10 years later (1909?) - www.flickr.com/photos/patopostcards/2170520985/

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yes, you are right, again! We had a lot of interest in this photo, from the tram lines to the cost of a ferry ticket to Manly. We've added a c.1899 date to this image. Thanks everyone for your help!

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Star Photo Co., c.1900-1910, State Library of NSW - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=413360

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's an interesting pic taken in ca. 1901, after the introduction of trams - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71471961 Notice how the T&CJ blanks out some of the advertising hoardings...I've caught them doing this on a few pics now.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Another great find. The Australian Town & Country Journal looks like it could  prove to be a valuable resource for us picture researchers.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: If we can believe the Sydney Mail, here's how things looked on 26/12/1897 - news.google.com/newspapers?id=C34QAAAAIBAJ&sjid=WpUDA... ; note how the SM (like the T&CJ) appears to have adopted the practice of blanking out some of the advertising hoardings and signs...an example here is the Cameo cigarette sign...maybe if you were an important Sydney Mail client then your sign didn't get blanked out...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Amongst this lot there's a couple of pics of the rebuild of wharves at Circular Quay...presumably the pics date from early in 1898 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71284246

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's an interesting article on the George Street tramway which was under construction in April 1898 - news.google.com/newspapers?id=YhFQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=WpUDA...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] What a great comparison! Thanks pellethepoet for noticing that, and thank you to State Records NSW for sharing the image.
